item.title: Yooka-Replaylee - Release Trailer
item.description: Yooka-Replaylee brings back the classic characters from Playtonic Games' 2017 action-platformer Yooka-Laylee with a new, remastered sheen. Yooka-Replaylee is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, Nintendo Switch 2, and PC.

item.title: What to Buy This Weekend: Best Steam Sales
item.description: So you want a lot of games but don’t want to spend much money? Well we’ve put together the best deals on Steam currently available with hot new games and rock bottom prices. Whatever genre you’re interested in, you’re bound to find something good!

item.title: StoneAge Pet World Codes (October 2025)
item.description:
StoneAge Pet World is a gacha RPG that takes place in the stone age, and your goal here is to survive. By earning Gems, Tokens, Stones, and other resources, you can tame and upgrade various dinosaurs to build a team that will protect you.

Redeeming StoneAge Pet World codes is a great opportunity to get everything you need for further development. Since the codes have a limited expiration date, you need to do this as soon as possible, so don't miss out to avoid putting your survival at risk.

All StoneAge Pet World Codes

Working StoneAge Pet World Codes

  • PETWORLD812 - Redeem this code to get 1,000 Blue Gems.

Expired StoneAge Pet World Codes

There are currently no expired StoneAge Pet World codes, so redeem active ones as soon as possible to avoid missing out on rewards.

Gacha RPGs are fast-paced in terms of gameplay, but sometimes there are moments when it is simply impossible to progress further without minimal improvements. This is where StoneAge Pet World codes and the tons of rewards they offer will help you.

How to Redeem Codes for StoneAge Pet World

Redeeming StoneAge Pet World codes is not difficult and will be available to you immediately after you complete the tutorial. Here are detailed instructions on how to find the right option, activate the codes, and receive rewards in this mobile game:

  • Launch StoneAge Pet World .
  • Pay attention to the bottom of the screen. There will be five buttons arranged in a row. Interact with the third one.
  • This will open a drop-down menu with many options. Interact with the button with the gear icon.
  • This will take you to the Options menu. Here, go to the Account tab by clicking the corresponding button at the bottom of the menu.
  • The account tab will also have many options, among which you will need to find and interact with the one that says Redeem Coupon.
  • This will open the redemption menu. It will contain an input field and a blue Use button below it. Now, enter one of the active codes from the list above into the input field.
  • Finally, click on the blue Use button to submit your request for rewards.

If everything is done correctly, a notification will appear on the screen with a list of rewards received.

How to Get More StoneAge Pet World Codes

New StoneAge Pet World codes are often published on the game's official social media pages by the developers themselves. So, if you want to try to find more codes on your own, be sure to visit each of these pages:

  • Official StoneAge Pet World X account.
  • Official StoneAge Pet World Facebook page.
  • Official StoneAge Pet World YouTube channel.

StoneAge Pet World is available on mobile devices.

item.title: How to Varial Kickflip in Skate 4
item.description:
Not too long after the soft launch of Skate , the soon-to-be-released Season 1 has finally dropped. It patches some frustrating issues for players, improves mechanics like character customization, makes visuals more engaging, and even introduces a Skate Pass.

Thankfully, the pass isn’t entirely premium. Even free-to-play skaters can unlock great rewards like cosmetics, emotes, and skateboard skins by spending Tix, the pass currency you can earn by finishing special tasks. One of these challenges you’ll come across is performing a Varial Kickflip. For those finding it difficult to pull off, here’s how to land Varial Kickflip easily in Skate 4 .

How to Varial Kickflip in Skate 4

Varial Kickflip is one of the trickier Ollie maneuvers in Skate that, of course, takes some practice to master. You’ve got to make your skateboard spin horizontally, flip the board in the air, and land right back on it.

Like most flip tricks, you’ll only need the right stick on your controller to nail it. That means no button-mashing or stressing over perfect timing like with more advanced tricks, such as Benihana.

To do a Varial Kickflip trick in Skate 4 , start from the middle and push your right stick down to the bottom-left, then flick it diagonally up toward the top-right, just like shown in the image above.

Whether you're using an Xbox or PlayStation controller, the motion stays the same as long as you have Goofy stance turned on in your stance preferences. If you’re using Regular stance, you’ll need to do the same motion but in the opposite direction : push the stick down to the bottom-right and then flick it diagonally up toward the top-left.

So, to sum up, here are the right stick inputs for a Varial Kickflip on both stances:

  • Goofy stance: move the stick from bottom-left to top-right.
  • Regular stance: move the stick from bottom-right to top-left.

Once you’ve landed it, just repeat the trick four more times to complete the Trick of the Day - Varial Kickflip Skate Pass task and earn 40 Tix. You can then use these tickets to unlock pass shop pages and grab your favorite items. On top of that, you’ll also get 150 Rip Chips, which can be exchanged for reward boxes.

Remember, you can also buy Tix with real money from the Tix Currency Packs section on the hub page, which makes it a pretty handy option for pay-to-win skateboarders.

12
7.3 /10

item.title: 7 Spider-Man Games That Need Remakes
item.description:
Spider-Man 's webslinging adventures have captured the attention of fans for generations. Players love the idea of controlling everyone's favorite neighborhood superhero, swinging around New York City, and smashing enemies to a pulp.

With Insomniac Studios knocking it out of the park with their offerings, the modern trajectory of this hero in the video game industry has been nothing short of incredible. However, people shouldn't forget the classics, with these nostalgic Spider-Man titles deserving all the time in the spotlight for being so much fun to play.

Spider-Man

A Classic Game That Would Be A Blast To Play With Improved Visuals

Spider-Man
Action-Adventure
Systems
7.5 /10
Released
September 1, 2000
ESRB
E // Animated Violence

Powered by

One of the most nostalgic games that people still have a soft spot for, 2000's Spider-Man is a lovable ode to this hero's legacy. This webhead must scale the rooftops of New York City and stop a horrifying plan from coming to pass.

As fun as it may be to play, there's no denying that Spider-Man hasn't aged the best. Jumping can feel wonky, and the camera is hard to control, two issues that can be fixed with a remaster that highlights this classic title for everyone to see.

Spider-Man 2: Enter Electro

An Underappreciated Game That More People Would Respect With A Remaster

Spider-Man 2: Enter Electro
7.0 /10
Released
August 26, 2001

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
E // Violence
Powered by

A sequel to everyone's favorite Spider-Man game that didn't enjoy the same level of love and adoration, Enter Electro is a game that deserves more time in the spotlight. A common criticism was that this game highlighted some of the more forgettable Spider-Man villains at the time, but this isn't a sentiment that carries over to the modern era.

With Spider-Man 's popularity as an IP growing, players are more familiar with villains like Electro, Shocker, Hammerhead, Lizard, and Sandman. Remastering this game and letting more people know about its existence would be an easy route to take, especially for people familiar with the first game.

Ultimate Spider-Man

An Amazing Cel-Shaded Adventure That Won't Take Too Much To Be Improved For Modern Audiences

Ultimate Spider-Man
7.0 /10
Released
September 22, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
T // Language, Violence
Powered by

Treyarch excelled in the development of Spider-Man 2 's console releases, which is why they were given the freedom to tackle a brand-new game that isn't tied down by the restrictions of having to adapt the movie. This led to Ultimate Spider-Man , a fun, cel-shaded superhero game that lets players control both Spider-Man and Venom.

Marvel's Spider-Man 2 made it clear that players would relish the chance to control Spider-Man's greatest nemesis, which is why Ultimate Spider-Man would be such an easy sell right now. A remake that polishes the controls and gameplay will highlight the title's timeless cel-shaded visuals and make it yet another fun Spider-Man game for fans to enjoy.

Spider-Man: Friend Or Foe

Teaming Up With Spider-Man's Iconic Friends And Villains Would Be A Blast

Spider-Man: Friend Or Foe
7.5 /10
Released
October 2, 2007

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
E 10+ // Cartoon Violence
Powered by

Friend or Foe is a must-play Spider-Man game for players who want to interact with this character's iconic roster of heroes and villains. It takes the designs of the Sam Raimi movies and introduces an alternate universe of sorts where Spidey's friends and foes must team up to tackle a massive threat.

The beat-'em-up gameplay and fun story ensure that fans will have a great time with this title. A remake is unlikely, but players will jump at the opportunity to pummel their enemies in this game with a fresh coat of paint.

Spider-Man 2

The Movie Tie-In Makes The Remake Tricky, But This Classic Game Will Make Waves If It Surpasses This Hurdle

Spider-Man 2
8.5 /10
Released
June 28, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen
Powered by

For a movie tie-in, it's amazing just how groundbreaking Spider-Man 2 was. It was the first game featuring the web-head to show the promise of swinging around in an open world, something that was carried out brilliantly at the time.

The nature of this game makes a remaster project tricky, but players who want to channel their nostalgia and deliver pizzas at a record-setting pace will love a Spider-Man 2 remaster. The combat and visuals could certainly use an upgrade, and the swinging is so entertaining that only a few tweaks will make it a blast to engage with for modern fans.

Spider-Man: Web Of Shadows

The Best Spider-Man Game Outside Of The Insomniac Titles In The Eyes Of Many

Spider-Man: Web of Shadows
7.3 /10
Released
October 21, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Web of Shadows is one of the greatest Spider-Man video games in the eyes of fans, with the focus on Spider-Man's morality as he switches between the Red and Black Suits at will, making for a great setup.

The animations and character models were a bit all over the place, but these are issues that a remake can address. With Spider-Man 's stock being higher than ever, a Web of Shadows remaster is ripe for the picking and let players enjoy one of the best depictions of the symbiote crisis in a video game as New York slowly becomes more hazardous with the growing alien epidemic.

Spider-Man: Shattered Dimensions

The Spider-Verse Is More Appealing Than Ever Before

Spider-Man: Shattered Dimensions
8 /10
8.0 /10
Released
September 7, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

The Spider-Verse movies have made it clear that people love a unique Spider-Man flick, but most people don't realize that this was already done before with Shattered Dimensions . Controlling four different versions of Spider-Man in a fun, zany adventure that's perfectly on brand for this hero makes Shattered Dimensions a blast to play through.

It's a shame that this game was one of the many delisted casualties after Activision's licensing deal with Marvel ended. Hopefully, some strings can be pulled to bring this game back in the form of a remaster to cater to new audiences.
